name: Super Mario Bros (Special Edition)
description:
Playable 3D simulation of this   classic handheld electronic game including views of the original packaging and instruction guide . A RetroFab simulation Version 0.9.5 (beta) Details Title Super Mario Bros. Model No. YM-901-S Series Game & Watch ( Special Edition ) Manufacturer Nintendo Release Date August 1, 1987 Chipset Sharp SM511 ( 32.768 kHz ) Description

Nintendo created this special edition of it's Super Mario Bros handheld LCD game (based on the NES video game of the same name) as a prize for winners of a competition it held in 1987. Only 10,000 copies were given away, making it the most rare of the 3 Game & Watch versions of the game.

Gameplay

Bowser and his Koopas (a tribe of turtles) have invaded the Mushroom Kingdom and kidnapped Princess Toadstool! To free the captured princess Mario must set out on a quest to rescue her by passing through 8 unique worlds:

  • World No. 1 - Canyon
    Leap between platforms to avoid falling into the canyon below.
     
  • World No. 2 - Gym
    Skip over obstacles and avoid being squashed by the walls.
     
  • World No. 3 - Burning Room
    A non-scrolling world where Mario must avoid the spinning flames in a timed challenge.
     
  • World No. 4 - Channel
    Mario must swim under water while avoiding the floating bars.
     
  • World No. 5 - Hop
    Leap between platforms while jumping over walls.
     
  • World No. 6 - Beam
    Another non-scrolling world where Mario must leap between moving beams in a timed challenge.
     
  • World No. 7 - Maze
    Carefully pick the right route through the maze.
     
  • World No. 8 - Burning Road
    Avoid the burning flames that lie on the road that leads to the princess

At the end of each world an illusion of the princess will appear to guide Mario to the next world. When all 8 Worlds are completed, the game loops and the next 8 Worlds await with even more challenges including enemies (Lakitu and Bullet Bill) that will try to stop Mario.
